title: Registration and setup
description: Ready to dive into Buttondown? This resource will help you sign up and configure some important settings before you send a newsletter to your subscribers.

title: Test mode
description: Send test emails to yourself to preview how they'll look to subscribers

title: Building your subscriber base
description: Now that your Buttondown newsletter is ready, it's time to add more subscribers and drive engagement.

title: Collecting and using subscribers’ names
description: Buttondown allows you to collect subscriber names, and create a more personalized email for your readers.

title: Keeping your newsletter private
description: Private Mode makes it easy to limit who can see you Buttondown newsletter.

title: How do I manually add subscribers?
description: You can easily add an email to your Buttondown newsletter, without an import.

title: Dealing with spammy subscribers
description: Spam happens. If you're seeing lots of spammy subscribers, please reach out and we'll help you out.

title: Why won't my embedded form submit?
description: Trouble with your Buttondown subscription form? Check your security settings.

title: Tags
description: Buttondown makes it easy to segment your readers by using tags.

title: Metadata
description: Want to do a "mail merge" on your Buttondown newsletter? We make it easy information in Metadata!

title: Surveys
description: Adding a survey to your Buttondown newsletter is a great way to engage with your readers.

title: Subscriber referrals
description: Buttondown provides the building blocks to build out your own referral system.

title: How can I segment users?
description: Buttondown allows you to segment your audience using tags, metadata, or by creating a new newsletter.

title: Importing your newsletter data
description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts, and subscribers from another service. We'll even do the import for you!

title: AWeber
description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts and subscribers from AWeber. We'll even do the import for you!

title: Beehiiv
description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts, subscribers and paid subscriptions from Beehiiv.

title: Importing your data from Benchmark
description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts and subscribers from Benchmark. We'll even do the import for you!

description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts and subscribers from Campaign Monitor. We'll even do the import for you!

description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts, subscribers and paid subscriptions from Substack. We'll even do the import for you!

title: Substack is taking 10% of my revenue. What should I do?
Uploading images in the editor
description: You can use the editor to easily add images to your Buttondown newsletter.

title: Previewing your email in an email inbox
description: Buttondown allows you to preview your email by sending yourself a draft.

title: Scheduling an email
description: Want to send an email some time in the future? Buttondown allows you to schedule an exact date and time to send.

title: Premium content
description: Buttondown makes it easy to share special perks and incentives with your paid readers.

title: Sending via email
description: Use Buttondown's Magic Email Address to send a newsletter without logging into the Dashboard.

title: Replies to your emails
description: Buttondown offers more sophisticated ways to manage your reader replies.

title: Warming up your email sending
description: How to properly warm up your sending domain when starting with Buttondown to ensure maximum deliverability

title: How do I avoid the "Promotions" tab in Gmail?
Why is my email all... purple?
Why does my email look different on some clients?
How can I write accessible emails?
How do I include audio in my newsletter?
What's the maximum size of a file that I can attach?
Can I set a custom reply-to address?
How do I set sender information?
How do I re-send an email that's been blocked or errored?
description: Buttondown can block email sends because of an error or an insufficient billing tier. To re-send the email, duplicate it, delete the original, and send the copy.

title: Buying a custom domain
description: Registering a custom domain helps you build a distinct and recognizable brand for your newsletter.

title: Sending from a custom domain
description: Buttondown allows all newsletters to send from a custom domain. This helps you build a recognizable brand and improves deliverability.

title: Hosting on a custom domain
description: Hosting your Buttondown archives on a custom domain helps establish your newsletter's brand.

title: Sending from DreamHost
description: This guide will help you connect your Dreamhost domain to your Buttondown newsletter.

title: Automating welcome sequences
description: You can use Buttondown's automations feature to create a welcome sequence for your new subscribers!

title: RSS-to-email
description: With Buttondown's RSS automation, you can automatically send a new email every time you publish a new blog post.

title: Paid subscriptions
description: Buttondown offers a variety of ways to offer paid subscriptions. And, we don't charge so you’ll keep all of the money that you make.

title: Offering perks for paid subscribers
description: Buttondown makes it easy to share special perks and incentives with your paid readers.

title: Sponsorships
description: Does your newsletter have sponsors? Learn how Buttondown can help you manage your sponsorships.

title: /buy
description: `/buy` is a durable URL that instantly spins up a new checkout link for your preferred paid subscribers who go through this URL.

title: Gift subscriptions
description: Gift subscriptions are a great way to "comp" a paid subscription to your friends, family, and favorite readers.

title: What pricing models can I use for my paid newsletter?
description: Buttondown offers a variety of different pricing models for your paid newsletter.

title: How to send a teaser email
description: Buttondown gives you the option of sending a "teaser" version of a paid email to encourage free readers to upgrade.

title: Allow subscribers to choose between paying monthly or yearly
description: You can configure Stripe to give your subscribers the option between a monthly and yearly plan when upgrading to a premium subscription for your newsletter.

title: Can I use Stripe Test mode with Buttondown?
description: Buttondown does not currently support Stripe's test mode.

title: Can I pay using something other than Stripe?
description: Buttondown uses Stripe as our payment processor for both our own customers, and paid newsletters.

title: How can I calculate and report my taxes?
description: Stripe can automatically collet can report taxes for your paid Buttondown newsletter.

title: How do I change the price of my paid newsletter?
description: You can change the price of your paid Buttondown newsletter by updating the product in Stripe.

title: Can I use Buttondown to set up a tip jar for my newsletter?
description: Buttondown's "pay what you want" pricing model works as a tip jar for your newsletter

title: Multiple newsletters
description: With Buttondown you can connect multiple newsletters to the same account and login

title: Data exports
description: At Buttondown you own your data. That's why we make it easy to download all your data any time you want it.

title: Can I recover my deleted data?
description: The Buttondown team can help recover deleted data within three days of deletion.

title: Teams
description: With our Teams feature you and your colleagues can collaborate on writing and managing your Buttondown newsletter.

title: Deleting your account
description: Buttondown allows you to easily export all your data, and delete your account. But we'll still be sad to see you go.

title: Dormancy
description: Dormancy is a status that allows you to mark newsletters as inactive without deleting them or affecting your billing.

title: Can I point my old Buttondown newsletter to a new URL?

Framer
description: Framer is a great no-code form tool that integrates with Buttondown.

title: Twitter
description: Automatically share your newsletters to your Twitter profile to promote your newsletter.

title: Tumblr
description: Automatically share your newsletters to your Tumblr blog to promote your newsletter.

title: Webflow
description: Is your site on Webflow and your newsletter on Buttondown? It's easy to connect them!

title: Wordpress
description: Using custom HTML blocks you can easily add your Buttondown subscriber form to your WordPress site.

description: Information on Buttondown's roadmap

description: Pricing information for Buttondown's paid plans.

description: Take advantage of Buttondown's flexible billing to pause your subscription when you need to.

description: Buttondown can clean up spammy or unactivated email addresses from your subscriber list.

description: Buttondown lets you let your subscribers change their metadata, tags, and more.

title: Customizing transactional emails
description: Buttondown's transactional emails, such as confirmation and welcome emails, can be customized using the same email CSS settings as regular emails.

description: The top of the Modern template has the newsletter's icon and name, and the email's subject and publication date, which some authors opt to hide using CSS.

Why is my Google Workspace domain not SPF-aligned?
description: Google Workspace alias domains may not have SPF alignment when also used for third-party providers, like Buttondown. In these cases, lack of SPF alignment is expected (for alias domains), and should not be a problem for deliverability.

title: Buttondown's pre-flight checks
description: Details about all the checks Buttondown performs before sending your newsletter.

description: Keeping your deliverability high is largely about managing your domain's reputation.

description: Buttondown's standards for engagement and deliverability.

title: Fixing a "suspicious link" warning in Gmail
description: You can appeal to Google when your website is flagged as a "suspicious link" in Gmail.

title: What does "Images in this message are hidden" mean?
description: When Gmail hides images in your emails, Gmail is trying to protect you from potentially unsafe content.

description: Events and webhooks allow you to monitor and react to any changes with your newsletter.

description: Buttondown's "Firewall" is an opt-in feature that audits all incoming subscribers to confirm that they're legitimate people.

description: Added `product` to `StripeSubscription`
Removed default filter for status in /v1/emails
New Attachments API endpoint
Split up date parameters into start and end
Exports can now be generated in JSON format
Added new newsletter customization fields to the API
Added new email statuses to really let you peek under the hood
Added UTM filtering parameters to the subscribers API
Added support for passing IP addresses to subscriber creation
Added support for filtering subscribers by undeliverability status and reason
A new `/images` endpoint for you to list your images
Override Buttondown's default collision behavior for new subscribers
Customize your API-borne exports
We've added support for filtering subscribers by referrer URL, too!
We've added support for filtering subscribers by IP address.
